comment: Reading a petition on a particular issue might educate some users.

This could be argued. In one sense, signing petitions implies that one is engaging with an issue, forming and opinion and expressing that opinion through participtation in the petition. In that sense, one does get better at signing petitions through signing petitions.  I remain skeptical about this assumption.
You can learn about issues before signing a petition. However, you could argue that simply signing a petition doesn't constitute "meaningful" participation.
